Package com.sicomsa.dmt

Class Client

java.lang.Object
com.sicomsa.dmt.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
DMTClient
public class Client extends Object implements DMTClient
Client is an implementation of DMTClient that calls DMTService in order to consume the massive cfdi download service.

Client keeps the authorized token in order to make requests, and renews it when needed. SAT tokens usually last 5 minutes.

You can specify a DMTService to use. If not, a default implementation will be used.

Since:
1.0
Version:
2025.01.03
Author:
Beto Lopez

    • getValidToken

      protected String getValidToken(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPConnection conn) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      Verifies the current Authorization to detect if the token is still valid and requests a new one if it is expired or has not yet gotten one. And returns a wrapped and ready to use valid token.
      Parameters:
      conn - the connection to use
      Returns:
      a wrapped valid token
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were SOAP related problems
      jakarta.xml.ws.WebServiceException - if there were service related problems

    • autentica

      protected Authorization autentica(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPConnection conn) throws jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException
      This method calls SAT's autentica service to authenticate and receive a token to be used in other requests. It returns an Authorization that contains the token and other instant related methods.
      Parameters:
      conn - the SOAP connection to use
      Returns:
      an Authorization that contains the token and other useful methods.
      Throws:
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there was a SOAP error
      jakarta.xml.ws.WebServiceException - if there were other service related problems
